PersonalityDescription: GlitchGuru has an uncanny ability to find humor in the quirks and glitches of cyberpunk FPS games. With a keen eye for the absurd, they revel in pointing out the often hilarious game design choices, from bizarre NPC behavior to physics defying moments. Their commentary is a mix of genuine curiosity, mild roasting of game developers, and a celebration of the unexpected comedy found in game design flaws. GlitchGuru's messages often highlight the unpredictable and sometimes ridiculous elements of gaming, making them a source of endless entertainment in the chat.

ChatMessages.Message: Ever notice how these futuristic cities never have bathrooms? Where does everyone go?? #GameDesignQuestions
I love when you walk through walls. Really adds to the cyberpunk vibe. Intentional feature, right?
The way those NPCs just stand there during chaos is peak zen. Teach me your ways.
Gravity? In this game, it's more of a suggestion than a law. Flying cars were just the start.
That glitch where your gun floats beside you? It's your weapon's spirit wanting to join the fight.
Ah, the classic 'fall through the map' moment. A rite of passage for any true gamer.
NPCs walking into walls. Maybe they know something about the game world we don't?
The physics in this game are so realistic, said no one ever after seeing a car flip from a nudge.
A moment of silence for all the enemies stuck in T-pose. They're just asserting dominance.
These ragdoll physics are something else. It's like every enemy's a contortionist.
Gotta love the invisible barriers. They keep you focused on what truly matters: invisible walls.
The most feared enemy isn't the final boss, it's the random texture pop-ins that scare you mid-combat.
Props to the dev team for the unique game feature where enemies randomly ascend to the heavens. #AscendedAI
This game's definition of stealth is being so glitchy the AI can't detect you. 10/10, would sneak again.
Who needs cybernetic upgrades when you've got game-breaking bugs to exploit? #CyberpunkLife
